intro: Arabis armeriifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rockcress, is a flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important plants such as cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or coastal environments. It features basal leaves that are narrow and linear, and its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters. Arabis armeriifolia is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in harsh conditions.
